Package com.tsuboin.encrypt

Class CaesarCipher

java.lang.Object
com.tsuboin.encrypt.CaesarCipher
All Implemented Interfaces:
Encryptor
public class CaesarCipher
extends java.lang.Object
implements Encryptor
The CasesarCipher class implements encrypt/decrypt methods from the Encrypt interface and its own Caesar Cipher logic. The Caesar Cipher encryption pattern replaces each character with that of another character "shift #" of places along a given range of chars. Range of encryption symbols is from ASCII 33(!) to 125 ( } ).
Version:
1.0
Author:
Narissa Tsuboi

  • Method Details

    • encrypt

      public java.lang.String encrypt​(java.lang.String s)
      Implements Encryptor interface encrypt method, provided string by calling encryptDecrypt, private helper function.
      Specified by:
      encrypt in interface Encryptor
      Parameters:
      s - The string to encrypt
      Returns:
      Encrypted form of s

    • decrypt

      public java.lang.String decrypt​(java.lang.String s)
      Implements Encryptor interface decrypt method, provided prev. encrypted string. Calls encryptDecrypt, private helper function.
      Specified by:
      decrypt in interface Encryptor
      Parameters:
      s - The string to decrypt
      Returns:
      Decrypted form of s

    • getShift

      private static int getShift()
      Calculates a random cipher shift between character range min. and max.
      Returns:
      Cipher shift/number of indexes to shift each char.

    • encryptDecrypt

      private java.lang.String encryptDecrypt​(java.lang.String s, boolean encrypt) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Validates string includes characters in between OFFSET_MIN and OFFSET_MAX. Given boolean 'True', encrypts string by shifting string 'shift' chars along the character range. Given boolean 'False', decrypts string by shifting string the same 'shift' in the opposite direction.
      Parameters:
      s - Encrypted or decrypted string
      encrypt - True for encrypt, False for decrypt
      Returns:
      Modified string
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • isPositionInRange

      private boolean isPositionInRange​(int indx)
      Validation function for encryptDecrypt. Confirms that index is between OFFSET_MIN and OFFSET_MAX.
      Parameters:
      indx - Position in string being encrypted/decrypted
      Returns:
      True if in range, False if out of range
